title: 'It's the best day of my golfing life': Rory McIlroy finally gets his green jacket
content: There were plenty of nerves involved, but in the end, McIlroy finally won the Masters, got to put on the winner's jacket and completed the career Grand slam.

title: Rory coaster ride nets Masters win, career Slam
content: Rory McIlroy gave up a big lead on the second nine and bogeyed the 72nd hole to create a tie, but he recovered to beat Justin Rose in a playoff to win the Masters.

title: Officials: Ex-LSU WR Lacy died in apparent suicide
content: Former LSU receiver Kyren Lacy, who was found dead Saturday night in Houston, died in an apparent suicide in his car while being pursued by authorities, according to a Harris County sheriff's report released Sunday.

title: Sources: Bueckers signing 3-year Unrivaled deal
content: Projected No. 1 overall WNBA draft pick Paige Bueckers is signing a three-year deal with the 3-on-3 league Unrivaled, sources told ESPN, and her first-year salary will pass what she would make in four years of her WNBA rookie contract, sources said.

title: Former NCAA woman of year dies in plane crash
content: Karenna Groff, a former MIT soccer player named the 2022 NCAA woman of the year, died Saturday, along with members of her family, in a plane crash in upstate New York.

title: Wild West: Clips clinch 5 seed; Dubs in play-in
content: The Clippers locked up the No. 5 seed with the win and will play the Nuggets. The Warriors fell into the play-in with the loss and will play Memphis in the 7-8 game.

title: Lakers will lean on Luka in prepping for Wolves
content: Seeing as he faced them in the playoffs last year, the Los Angeles Lakers plan to rely on Luka Doncic's experiences in playing the Timberwolves, this year's Round 1 opponent, after the superstar defeated Minnesota as a member of the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Source: Bears make Gordon highest-paid slot CB
content: Bears cornerback Kyler Gordon agreed to a three-year, $40 million extension with $31.25 million guaranteed, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: U.S.-based Original Six all miss playoffs in NHL 1st
content: The Original Six teams based in the United States -- the Red Wings, Bruins, Blackhawks and Rangers -- will all miss the playoffs in the same year for the first time in NHL history.

title: First look at the NBA postseason bracket: X factors, best-case scenarios and big questions for all 20 teams
content: Everything you need to know about the 20 teams battling it out in the postseason, including first-round matchups and biggest playoff questions.

title: NBA postseason tracker: Playoff picture set; play-in begins Tuesday
content: With the regular season now over, see which teams clinched playoff spots ahead of the play-in tournament.

title: From 'Ted Lasso' appearances to honest talks about being fired: Inside Pete Carroll's USC class
content: This spring, in addition to being named head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders, Carroll has been moonlighting as a college professor.

title: NBA playoffs 2025: First-round news, scores and highlights
content: Here's everything you need to know about the 2025 NBA playoffs, including scores, news and highlights.

title: Projecting WNBA draft first round: Bueckers still No. 1 as Malonga rises; Van Lith, Prince out
content: The No. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith and Sedona Prince drop out of the first round.

title: MLB Watchability Index: Ranking which teams are must-see this season
content: Star power, mammoth home runs and ... cotton candy fries? Here are baseball's most exciting squads for 2025.

title: Man United season hinges on Europa League after Newcastle loss
content: The Newcastle loss doesn't alter Man United's Premier League outlook, but their eggs are now entirely in Europe.

title: Liverpool show how Premier League champions respond to adversity
content: Liverpool labored against West Ham and looked like they might drop points -- until Virgil van Dijk stepped up.

title: The draft's biggest risers: Seven players who have boosted their stock since last summer
content: Kyle Williams and Darien Porter are among the 2025 prospects who have improved their draft status this year.

title: Weekend review: Europa League hopes keeping Ange in Spurs job
content: After yet another loss, is Ange Postecoglou's time at Spurs up? That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Banda's Pride No. 1, winless Utah sink
content: Barbra Banda ensured Orlando remain top of ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings, while the Utah Royals are struggling.

title: Mbappé 'sorry' for rash red card - Madrid coach
content: Kylian Mbappe was shown a straight red card for a dangerous challenge during the first half of Real Madrid's crucial La Liga clash with Alavés.

title: Messi 'changing how world sees MLS' with Miami
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano credited Lionel Messi for impacting the growth of Major League Soccer since signing with the club in 2023, but quickly added that more progress can be made.

title: Liverpool near title after VVD winner, Salah record
content: Liverpool resumed their march to a second Premier League title on Sunday after beating West Ham United 2-1, with Mohamed Salah breaking the record for most goal involvements in a season and Virgil Van Dijk scoring a late winner.

title: Amorim won't commit to Onana for Europa League
content: Ruben Amorim said he will wait to make a decision on his goalkeeper for the crucial Europa League clash with Lyon after omitting Andre Onana from the defeat to Newcastle on Sunday.

title: Points then pints: Wolves boss hits pub with fans
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers coach Vitor Pereira is happy to swap the wine of his native Portugal for the beer of England's Black Country as he celebrates his side's 4-2 home win over Tottenham Hotspur on Sunday.

title: Salah makes Van Dijk plea as CB hints at new deal
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has said he would "love" to play with Virgil van Dijk next season after the Dutchman dropped a massive hint over his future.

title: Barcelona vs Real Madrid scheduled for May 11
content: The potentially title-deciding Clásico between Barcelona and Real Madrid at the Olympic Stadium has been scheduled for May 11.

title: Heartbreak for Brady as Birmingham lose in final
content: Birmingham City were dealt a shock 2-0 defeat by Peterborough United in the Vertu Trophy final at Wembley Stadium on Sunday, with NFL legend and minority owner of the club Tom Brady watching on.

title: 'Bryson's in the backyard': A Masters contender comes to visit
content: Before Bryson DeChambeau shot a Saturday 69 to get himself into contention, he was putting in work on a stranger's putting green.

title: 'An ordinary guy': What's John Daly doing at the Hooters in Augusta?
content: Daly hasn't played the Masters since 2006, but every year he shows up in town to hang and sell merch.

title: Why Sedona Prince is the toughest WNBA draft prospect to evaluate
content: She's a skilled 6-7 center, but some GMs have expressed doubt about drafting Sedona Prince after accusations of intimate partner violence.

title: 'They're the ones who made me love gymnastics again': After heartbreak, Konnor McClain has found joy at LSU
content: Konnor McClain dealt with devastating loss and tough injuries, but she's back at the top of NCAA gymnastics.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid want Haaland if Vinícius Júnior leaves
content: Real Madrid have been linked with a huge move for Erling Haaland if Vinícius Júnior leaves. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mehul Choksi Arrest: Belgium Confirms Working On India's Extradition Request
content: Belgian justice department has confirmed to NDTV that Mehul Choksi was arrested on Saturday following an extradition request from India.

title: "They Abandoned Brave Nationalist...": PM's Sankaran Nair Jab At Congress
content: PM Modi attacked the Congress for having "abandoned" the memory of Chettur Sankaran Nair - a lawyer and freedom fighter from Kerala, who resigned as the sole Indian on the Viceroy's Executive Council after the Jallianwala Bagh massacre of 1919.

title: When Mehul Choksi Alleged Abduction, And A Hungarian Woman's 'Honeytrap'
content: Nearly four years before his arrest in Belgium, wanted businessman Mehul Choksi was arrested in the Dominican Republic for illegal entry. He had then alleged that Indian agents forcibly removed him from Antigua and Barbuda

title: Donald Trump Or Xi Jinping: Who Has More Cards In Trade War?
content: While many countries opted not to retaliate against Donald Trump's now-delayed reciprocal tariff hikes, China took a different tack.

title: Mehul Choksi Tried To Escape To Switzerland. How He Was Tracked Down
content: Diamantaire Mehul Choksi's arrest in Belgium is the result of a relentless pursuit by Indian agencies for over seven years and spanning three countries that faced multiple setbacks.

title: China Halts Export Of Key Metals, Magnet As Trade War With US Intensifies
content: As the trade war between the US and China escalates, Beijing has suspended the export of several critical rare earth elements, metals and magnets, threatening to choke off supplies to the West

title: Video: Teen Refuses To Fall For Fake Trick, Leaves Scammer Speechless
content: This incident showcases the importance of awareness and caution when dealing with suspicious calls or messages.

title: Will Mehul Choksi Be Extradited After Arrest? What India-Belgium Treaty Says
content: Mehul Choksi is wanted by India for allegedly defrauding the Punjab National Bank of more than Rs 13,500 crore.

title: Video Proof: 'Substitute' Rohit Masterminds MI's Turnaround Against DC
content: It was a turnaround to remember for ages from Mumbai Indians during their IPL 2025 match vs Delhi Capitals on Sunday.

title: Why India May Not Agree To 'Zero-For-Zero Tariffs' With US Under Trade Deal
content: With India and the United States set to begin virtual talks over the proposed bilateral trade agreement (BTA) this week, New Delhi is unlikely to agree to a zero-for-zero' tariff strategy with Washington.

title: India's 156.7 Kmph Pace Sensation To Return For LSG. But There Is A Twist
content: Lucknow Super Giants fast bowler Mayank Yadav has recovered from his injuries and will soon join the franchise in the ongoing IPL 2025, according to a report.

title: "If You Play With Fire...": Sheikh Hasina's Warning For Muhammad Yunus
content: Ousted Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina tore into the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government on Sunday, branding him as a "self-centered loan shark" who plotted the country's downfall with foreign players to quench his thirst for power.

title: Fire Erupts At Hotel Where Sunrisers Hyderabad IPL Players Are Staying
content: Fire erupted this morning at a luxury hotel in Hyderabad where the players of the Indian Premier League (IPL) home team are staying.

title: "No Value For Me...": Karun Nair Clean Bowls All With Remarks In Presser
content: Not many batters have hit Jasprit Bumrah for two sixes in an over, and Karun underlined his preparation as a key to success, having gained enough confidence during the domestic season in which he aggregated 1870 runs for Vidarbha across formats.

title: Video: Teen Refuses To Fall For Fake Trick, Leaves Scammer Speechless
content: This incident showcases the importance of awareness and caution when dealing with suspicious calls or messages.

title: Video Proof: 'Substitute' Rohit Masterminds MI's Turnaround Against DC
content: It was a turnaround to remember for ages from Mumbai Indians during their IPL 2025 match vs Delhi Capitals on Sunday.

title: India has requested fugitive Mehul Choksi's extradition, confirms Belgium
content: Fugitive Mehul Choksi, wanted in connection with the Rs 13,000 crore PNB bank loan fraud, has been arrested in Belgium following an extradition request from India. Indian authorities are actively pursuing his extradition, presenting arrest warrants to Belgian officials. Choksi's lawyer is contesting the extradition, citing concerns about human rights and prison conditions in India, claiming the case is politically motivated.

title: UP woman stripped off hijab, Hindu man beaten in Muzaffarnagar; 6 held
content: In Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh, a shocking incident occurred where a 20-year-old woman was allegedly assaulted and stripped of her hijab, while her male companion was beaten. The attack, captured in a viral video, took place in Khalapar as they returned from collecting a loan EMI.

title: 'Shariat first, then Constitution': JMM minister sparks row, BJP hits back
content: The BJP strongly criticized Jharkhand minister Hafizul Hassan for his "a Muslim keeps the Quran in his heart and the Constitution in his hand" remarks, deeming them an insult to Indian democracy. Speaking on the ongoing Waqf protests Hassan had said that Muslims hold the Quran in their hearts and the Constitution in their hands. The BJP accused the INDIA bloc of harboring individuals who prioritize religious law. Hassan had alleged the Centre is targeting Muslims and warns of potential unrest.

title: PNB scam: How Mehul Choksi was tracked down and arrested in Belgium
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, wanted in connection with the Rs 14,000 crore PNB scam, has been arrested in Belgium following renewed extradition efforts by Indian probe agencies. After evading authorities since 2018, Choksi was detained from a hospital where he was receiving medical treatment. Indian agencies are completing extradition procedures, while Choksi may seek relief on medical grounds.

title: 'Unscientific, junk it': Karnataka caste census report divides Congress
content: A leaked Karnataka caste census report proposing increased OBC and Muslim reservations has ignited controversy within the Congress government. The report suggests raising OBC reservation to 51% and Muslims to 8%, sparking accusations of being "unscientific." Vokkaligas and Lingayats are recommended 7% and 8% quotas, respectively. With total reservations potentially reaching 73.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO disagrees that America's next gen is in bad shape
content: JP Morgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon advised young investors to focus on America's promising future, citing its vast wealth and potential advancements in health and technology. He stressed prioritizing mental and physical well-being, alongside treating others with respect.

title: Watch: Fists fly in the stands as fight erupts at Arun Jaitley Stadium
content: Delhi Capitals' winning streak ended abruptly against Mumbai Indians amidst on-field tension and off-field violence. A fan brawl marred the match, raising concerns about stadium security, while a collision between Karun Nair and Jasprit Bumrah ignited a heated exchange. Adding to Delhi's woes, captain Axar Patel was fined for a slow over-rate, impacting their standing in the league.

title: PM Modi hails Sankaran Nair ahead of 'Kesari 2' release
content: Narendra Modi praised Kerala's Sankaran Nair for his fight against British rule. This was after the 1919 Jallianwala Bagh tragedy. Modi wants people in Punjab, Haryana, and Himachal to know Nair's story. A film on Nair's legal battle, "Keasari 2", is releasing soon. Nair resigned from the Viceroy's Executive Council in protest.

title: Lodha brothers resolve disputes over brand names
content: Abhishek and Abhinandan Lodha have settled their dispute. The dispute was regarding the use of 'Lodha' and 'Lodha Group' brand names. Macrotech Developers will own the 'Lodha' brand. Abhinandan will retain the 'House of Abhinandan Lodha' brand. Both groups will operate independently. The Bombay High Court had appointed a mediator. The mediator helped in resolving the matter.

title: When Steve Jobs explained to Barack Obama why iPhones can’t be made in US
content: President Trump's push to revitalize US manufacturing through tariffs faces challenges, particularly for tech giants like Apple heavily reliant on Chinese production. Despite some supply chain diversification, Apple's iPhone manufacturing remains largely in China due to scale, speed, and specialized skills.

title: 'Enemies of Babasaheb': Kharge counters PM's 'votebank ka virus' charge
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has strongly criticized the BJP, labeling them as historical and current adversaries of B.R. Ambedkar. This retort followed PM Modi's accusation that Congress spreads "votebank ka virus" by opposing the Waqf Amendment Act.

title: From Antigua to Belgium: Will Choksi finally be extradited to India?
content: Mehul Choksi, wanted in connection with the Rs 13,000 crore PNB loan fraud, has been arrested in Belgium following a request from India for his extradition. This development follows the removal of an Interpol Red Notice and renewed efforts by Indian authorities to bring him back. Choksi had previously fled to Antigua and Dominica after the scam's exposure.

title: Machete-wielding teens on bikes: Rising trend in Bengaluru alarms cops
content: Bengaluru is witnessing a surge in incidents involving youths brandishing machetes and performing dangerous stunts, prompting concern from law enforcement and mental health experts. Recent arrests highlight a troubling trend of aggression and weapon possession among adolescents. Psychiatrists attribute this behavior to unresolved emotional issues and urge parents to be vigilant and seek professional help when needed.

title: How Apple and other tech companies’ ‘problems’ may not be over yet
content: President Trump is set to introduce tariffs on imported semiconductors, potentially reshaping the electronics trade. This follows a temporary reprieve for smartphones and computers from reciprocal tariffs on China. Trump emphasized the need to bolster domestic chip production and hinted at possible exemptions, while a national security investigation into the semiconductor sector is underway.

title: 'Paid twice': Auto driver who dropped Saif Ali Khan attacker identifies him
content: The chargesheet in Saif Ali Khan's attack case reveals Shariful Fakir, an illegal Bangladeshi national, was dropped near Khan's residence hours before the incident. CCTV footage captured Fakir surveying the area and entering the building.

title: 7 years after pulling out, why is Trump re-engaging Iran on nuclear deal?
content: Iran is not allowed to have nuclear weapons because it is a member of the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT), which it signed along with most other countries. This agreement allows countries to use nuclear technology only for peaceful purposes, like energy, medicine, and agriculture. It strictly prohibits the development of nuclear weapons.

title: Mehul Choksi undergoing cancer treatment, to seek bail - Top developments
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, wanted in the PNB scam, has been apprehended in Belgium. India faces an uphill battle for his extradition, as Choksi is likely to cite health issues to resist returning. Whistleblower Hariprasad SV doubts Choksi's return, given his resources and legal support. Nirav Modi, also implicated, remains jailed in London, fighting extradition.

title: Furore over Karnataka caste survey data, many netas call it ‘unscientific’
content: A leaked Karnataka caste census report has ignited controversy, revealing recommendations to increase backward caste reservations to 51%. The report, which has divided the ruling Congress, suggests specific reservation percentages for Muslims, Vokkaligas, and Veerashaiva-Lingayats. Opposition parties criticize the report, while community leaders question its accuracy, prompting a special cabinet meeting to address the contentious findings.

title: 'Votebank ka virus': PM Modi attacks Congress for opposing Waqf Act
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a strong critique of the Congress party on Monday, accusing them of exploiting the Constitution for political gain and neglecting Dr. BR Ambedkar's vision. He highlighted the Emergency and alleged politicization of reservations. Modi contrasted this with the BJP's development-focused approach.

title: 'Jaat' box office collection: Sunny Deol starrer to 'hold steady', cross Rs 50cr
content: Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' is performing strongly at the box office, showing significant growth over its opening weekend, particularly on Sunday. The film has earned Rs 41.47 crore in India and is approaching the Rs 50 crore mark, potentially boosted by the Ambedkar Jayanti holiday. In the south centres, 'Jaat' is facing competition from Ajith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly'.

title: IGI Airport T2 to shut for repairs from tomorrow; flights to shift to T1
content: Delhi Airport's Terminal 2 will close for repairs on April 15, 2025, prompting airlines like IndiGo and Akasa to shift operations to Terminal 1, which will then operate at full capacity. DIAL is trialing baggage transfers between T3 and T1 to ease connections, aiming for a 120-minute transfer time from T1 to T3, despite the lack of an air train.

title: 'Message warned to blow up vehicle': Salman Khan receives another death threat
content: Salman Khan is facing a new death threat, received via a WhatsApp message to Mumbai's Transport Department, warning of an attack on his house and a bomb threat to his car. Following this, a police complaint has been filed, and authorities are investigating the threat's origin. As of now, it's not clear if this threat has come from Lawrence Bishnoi.

title: 'His wallet is full': PNB scam whistleblower reacts to Choksi's arrest
content: PNB scam whistleblower Hariprasad SV expressed concerns about Mehul Choksi's extradition to India, citing his history of evading legal proceedings and access to top-tier European lawyers. Choksi's recent arrest in Belgium has sparked preparations for extradition, but he is expected to mount a strong legal defense, challenging the process based on health and other factors.

title: 'My emotional support animal': Four charged after riding horses through Walmart
content: Four U.S. individuals, known as the "Cutthroat Cowboys," face charges after riding horses through a Walmart in Baker, Louisiana. A viral video captured the group startling customers and staff, leading to public outcry and a police investigation. Mason Webb stated their actions were for amusement and social media attention, claiming the horse as an emotional support animal.

title: PM Modi flags off first commercial flight to Ayodhya from Hisar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a commercial flight from Hisar to Ayodhya and laid the foundation for a new terminal at Maharaja Agrasen Airport, costing over ₹410 crore. This initiative aims to enhance air travel accessibility with modern facilities, including a cargo terminal and ATC building, expected to be completed in two years.

title: Bengaluru techie tries to set himself on fire outside governor's house
content: Zuhail Ahmed, a Hebbal resident, attempted suicide outside Raj Bhavan, alleging harassment related to a domestic violence case filed by his wife in Chikkaballapura. He claimed the police weren't listening to his complaints and that there were attempts to harm him.

title: 'The fake news': Trump's granddaughter Kai joins him at 2am presser- video
content: Donald Trump, following a UFC event in Miami, playfully introduced his granddaughter, Kai Trump to reporters labelling them as "fake news" during a 2 am pressor aboard Air Force One. Kai, a competitive golfer committed to the University of Miami, was accompanied by her brothers. The event drew a crowd of political and tech figures, including Elon Musk and Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

title: Jeff Bezos' fiancee & Katy Perry to launch into space: Timing & other details
content: Lauren Sánchez led an all-female crew, including Katy Perry and Gayle King, on Blue Origin's New Shepard rocket on April 14, 2025. The NS-31 mission, part of Blue Origin's initiative to democratize space travel, reached past the Kármán line. This launch precedes Sánchez's summer wedding to Jeff Bezos in Venice, with a star-studded guest list.

title: WATCH: Bumrah, Karun have heated exchange during DC vs MI
content: During Sunday's IPL 2025 match between Delhi Capitals and Mumbai Indians, Karun Nair's impressive 89 off 40 balls was overshadowed by a heated argument with Jasprit Bumrah following an on-field spat. Despite Nair's efforts, Mumbai Indians secured a 12-run victory, powered by Tilak Varma's 59 and contributions from other batters.

title: Indians in US: Students urged caution about social media posts
content: Despite stricter US immigration policies, Indian students' interest in US higher education, especially STEM and AI programs, remains strong. A surge in applications to top universities indicates enduring appeal, driven by research opportunities and post-graduation prospects. Experts advise proactive planning and strategic visa applications amidst uncertainties, emphasizing adaptability and early job market preparation.

title: Indian Coast Guard and Gujarat ATS intercept over 300kg narcotics
content: In a joint operation, the Indian Coast Guard and Gujarat ATS seized over 300kg of narcotics worth approximately Rs 1,800 crore. The ICG ship intercepted a transshipment attempt near the International Maritime Boundary Line based on intelligence from Gujarat ATS. While the suspects fled across the IMBL, the ICG recovered the jettisoned narcotics.

title: Ambedkar Jayanti: 50+ wishes, messages, quotes, images to share
content: Ambedkar Jayanti, observed annually on April 14th, commemorates the birth of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, a pivotal figure in India's social reform and the architect of its Constitution. The day honors his relentless fight against caste discrimination and his advocacy for equality, liberty, and fraternity. Celebrations include tributes, rallies, and discussions, reinforcing his enduring legacy of social justice and empowerment.

title: Midnight molestation in Bengaluru: Accused nabbed after 600 CCTV scans
content: A 26-year-old man, Santosh Daniel, was arrested in Kerala for allegedly molesting a girl in Bengaluru. The incident, captured on CCTV, sparked outrage and a police manhunt. Daniel, a test driver, fled the city after the video went viral, leading police to trace him through multiple states using CCTV footage and technical analysis.

title: PNB bank loan 'fraud' case: Fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi arrested in Belgium
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, wanted in the Rs 14,000-crore Punjab National Bank fraud, has been arrested in Belgium based on India's extradition request. He is accused of colluding with bank officials to fraudulently obtain financial instruments, causing significant losses. Choksi's legal team is preparing to challenge the extradition, citing his medical condition as a key factor.

title: China says exports facing severe external situation, but 'sky will not fall'
content: "At present, China's exports are facing a complex and severe external situation, but 'the sky will not fall'," the spokesperson said, news agency Reuters. He also stated that China is "actively building a diversified market, deepening cooperation with all parties in the supply chain," and added, "Importantly, China's domestic demand market is broad."

title: Vince gets hair dryer as reward for century; netizens can't stop laughing
content: In a bizarre scheme of things in the Pakistan Super League 2025, James Vince of Karachi Kings received a hair dryer as the 'Reliable Player' award after his match-winning century against Multan Sultans. Vince's explosive 101 off 43 balls, coupled with Khushdil Shah's 60, powered Karachi to a record-breaking chase of 235.

title: Stock Markets closed on April 14 for Ambedkar Jayanti
content: Indian stock exchanges will be closed on Monday for Dr BR Ambedkar Jayanti. Last week, the markets closed positively, recovering from an initial decline triggered by US-China tariff concerns. Investors are now awaiting corporate earnings reports from major companies like Wipro, Infosys, HDFC Bank, and ICICI Bank in the holiday-shortened week.

title: 'Come see kids, hospitals': Zelenskyy urges Trump to visit Ukraine before talks
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy has urged Donald Trump to visit Ukraine before making decisions about the conflict with Russia, emphasizing the need to witness the devastation firsthand. Zelenskyy insists that a visit would help Trump understand Vladimir Putin's intentions and the true nature of the war. This appeal comes amid ongoing efforts to find a resolution, with Trump expressing concern over a recent Russian strike in Sumy.

title: Veteran Kannada comedy actor Bank Janardhan passes away at 79
content: Kannada cinema lost a beloved figure as veteran comedy actor Bank Janardhan passed away at 79 due to prolonged illness and multi-organ complications. Known for his impeccable comic timing and character roles in over 500 films, including Shhh! and Tarle Nan Maga, he also charmed audiences through television serials like Papa Pandu.

title: To combat heat, DU principal applies cow dung on classroom walls, sparks row
content: Lakshmibai College's principal, Pratyush Vatsala, applied cow dung to classroom walls in Block C to combat the heat, aiming for an eco-friendly solution amidst infrastructure issues. This unconventional method, intended as an internal update, sparked debate on social media, highlighting the need for better facilities like fans and coolers in older buildings.

title: Police hunts for judge instead of thief in bizarre mix-up
content: In Firozabad, a sub-inspector was assigned to serve a court order. He was supposed to find a theft suspect. Instead, he pursued the judge, Nagma Khan. The officer misread the document. He reported that "accused Nagma Khan" could not be found. The court criticized the officer's negligence. An inquiry was ordered. The officer was transferred to police lines.

title: Silkyara tunnel that collapsed in 2023 set to see light
content: After months of setbacks following a collapse in November 2023, the Silkyara tunnel project in Uttarakhand is set to achieve a breakthrough on Wednesday. Excavation will be completed, paving the way for the 4.5 km tunnel to be operational within a year. Despite a probe revealing negligence, the government has decided to proceed with the Char Dham Road connectivity project.

title: Puthandu: Top 50 Tamil new year wishes, messages, images & quotes to share
content: Puthandu 2025, celebrated on April 14th, marks the Tamil New Year, a time for fresh starts and cultural festivities. The occasion is observed with family gatherings, traditional feasts, and the exchange of heartfelt wishes. This year, share joy and blessings with loved ones through a curated collection of messages, quotes, and greetings, embracing the spirit of community and new beginnings.

title: IPL match today: LSG vs CSK - all you need to know
content: Chennai Super Kings, enduring a five-match losing streak and struggling with batting woes, seek redemption against the confident Lucknow Super Giants. LSG, positioned fourth with four wins, aim to maintain their momentum. Historically, LSG holds a 3-1 head-to-head advantage, setting the stage for a crucial clash at the Ekana Cricket Stadium with favourable weather conditions expected.

title: UFC 314 takeaways: Volkanovski is back, Pimblett shines -- again
content: Alexander Volkanovski defeated Diego Lopes by unanimous decision to win the featherweight championship . yair Rodriguez revived his career with an impressive performance to ruin Patricio Pitbull's debut . "Old Man Volk" is champion once again but the division is a lot different than the one he reigned over .

title: How the standings can shift with Monday's six games
content: the six games taking place on tuesday are scheduled for the end of the regular season . 14 of 16 clubs have punched their tickets, though a variety of seeds remain in contention . a win by the Columbus Blue Jackets on Sunday kept them in the playoff race for at least one more day .

title: Russell escapes penalty for DRS breach, keeps P2
content: a post-race investigation into his incorrect use of his car's drag reduction system (DRS) he was in second place, behind race winner Oscar Piastri . his car also lost connection with the circuit's automated DRS activation system . the system exists to ensure drivers do not use the DRS overtaking aid .

title: India tests laser system to destroy aerial targets
content: 8 incredible places in India to witness peacocks dance Meenakshi Chaudhary's picture-perfect moments 10 tips by Sadhguru for a happy married life 10 strict parenting rules that actually make kids better human beings 8 low-calorie desserts that actually taste good Alia Bhatt to Rashmika Mandanna: Contrasting saree-blouses approved by B-town ladies Baby girl names inspired by the sacred rivers of India Grace in every move: Hema Malini stuns in stunning Bharatanatyam attires From Ek Do Teen to Maar Dala: Madhuri Dixit's most iconic dance looks through the years

title: WNBA DraftCast: Ranking the top 50 prospects for 2025
content: projected no. 1 overall WNBA draft pick Paige Bueckers is signing a three-year deal with the 3-on-3 league Unrivaled, source says . the no. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith, sedona Prince drop out of the first round . some athletes with historically black college roots could hear names called .

title: Wetzel: House settlement officially ends college amateurism, and good riddance
content: amateurism, at least in college athletics, is a good settlement . it will soon open the door for college athletic departments to pay athletes directly with revenue gleaned from media rights, tickets, sponsorships and so on . many think it's what many think should have happened generations ago . this would be official death certificate, though .

title: US teen allegedly killed parents to finance plan to assassinate Trump
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Waqf Act protest: Hundreds cross Ganga to flee Murshidabad violence in Bengal
content: Radiant snaps of Samyuktha 8 Drinks that can reduce inflammation in summers South heroines who slay in traditional wear 8 incredible places in India to witness peacocks dance Meenakshi Chaudhary's picture-perfect moments 10 tips by Sadhguru for a happy married life 10 strict parenting rules that actually make kids better human beings 8 low-calorie desserts that actually taste good Alia Bhatt to Rashmika Mandanna: Contrasting saree-blouses approved by B-town ladies

title: Vetting knot: New spouses of US citizens face tough checks
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More Ambedkar Jayanti 2025: 8 must-read books by Babasaheb Ambedkar How to use Raisin water to increase hair growth National Gardening Day 2025: 10 plants and flowers that every garden should have Times Sonu Kakkar gave us solid fashion goals in ethnic wear Madhuri Dixit Nene's best ethnic looks How to make Ragi Cheela at home ​10 beautiful fishes that are pink in colour Puffin Day 2025: 8 interesting facts about these adorably colourful birds Radiant snaps of Samyuktha

title: Next year's Bengal Assembly polls must be held under President's rule: Suvendu Adhikari
content: ‘Wherever Hindus are in the minority, they are stopped from voting. Police act like cadres of the ruling party,’ Mr. Adhikari told reporters in Kolkata

title: Investors' wealth erodes by ₹11.30 lakh crore since reciprocal tariffs announcement; Sensex drops 2%
content: Market participants fear that tensions between the world's two largest economies could cause widespread global damage.

title: Place Gig Workers draft bill in public domain for stakeholders views: Telangana CM
content: The Govt wants to enact the Act on May 1 (International Labour Day); There are 4 lakh gig workers in Telangana

title: PM to inaugurate Khelo India Youth Games 2025 in Patna: Nitish
content: According to the office of the Chief Minister, 8,500 athletes and 1,500 technical staff from across the country will take part in the Khelo India Youth Games, 2025

title: Pramoda Devi Wadiyar says villagers need not worry about claim of erstwhile Mysuru royal family over properties in Chamarajanagar
content: “Even if the ownership of the land is transferred in the name of the erstwhile royal family,” Ms Wadiyar assured, “no trouble will be caused to the villagers”

title: CPI moves SC challenging constitutional validity of Waqf (Amendment) Act
content: The plea filed through advocate Ram Sankar in the top court said the Amendment Act, published on April 5 following the assent of the President, substantially curtails the autonomy of the Waqf Board and fundamentally transforms the framework of the Waqf Act, 1995

title: Telangana Govt notifies rules for implementation of SC categorisation in public employment and educational institutions
content: Posts meant for SC communities should be carried forward if no eligible candidate from SCs is found and should not be filled with candidates belonging to any other community other than SCs, as per the rules

title: JD(U) must take 'serious note' of Haryana CM's statement on Bihar: Tejashwi Yadav
content: ‘Our victory march that saw the BJP return to power in Haryana must continue in Bihar. I am sure the elections will be won by the BJP under the leadership of Samrat Choudhary,’ Mr. Saini said at a function in Delhi

title: Diary found in Kalyan rape-murder accused's cell, claims he was depressed: Police
content: The inmate was found dead in the Navi Mumbai jail and his diary entries say he was upset that his wife was avoiding him and did not believe him

title: Telangana becomes first State to notify Scheduled Castes categorisation
content: Gazette notification with April 14 as appointed day for implementation of SC categorisation issued; Recruitment to government jobs would forthwith be based on the categorisation

title: Bengaluru: Chaos at Namma Metro Majestic station as train frequency dips
content: The disruption was attributed to a lower-than-usual train frequency on account of the government holiday for Ambedkar Jayanti.

title: Fifteen foreigners nabbed for illegal stay in India, sent for deportation
content: Besides the Bangladeshis, 12 Nigerians and one from Ivory Coast were apprehended during an operation carried out in the Mohan Garden and Uttam Nagar areas

title: Former Himachal Pradesh Minister Virendra Kanwar gets ransom call, death threat; case registered
content: According to the complaint, the caller had introduced himself as Dharmendra from Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh even though the True Caller app showed his name as Irfan Khan

title: Punjab LoP Bajwa booked after being quizzed by police over '50 bombs' claim
content: In an interview, Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa claimed, “I have come to know that 50 bombs have reached Punjab. Of this, 18 have exploded, 32 are yet to go off.”

title: Modi govt only pays lip service to Ambedkar, BJP-RSS his enemies: Kharge
content: Hitting out at PM Modi over his criticism of the Congress' treatment of Ambedkar, Mr. Kharge cited a letter by Ambedkar in which he blamed S.A. Dange and V.D. Savarkar for his defeat in the elections of 1952

title: Studied over 21 years, new frog species ‘Leptobrachium aryatium’ named after Assam college
content: The Leptobrachium aryatium was recorded from Garbhanga Reserve Forest, a degrading biodiversity hotspot on the edge of Assam’s principal city

title: Pawan Kalyan's wife performs head-tonsuring at Tirumala
content: Anna Konidela did it to fulfill a vow she had taken when her son suffered burns in a fire accident at a school

title: Congress exploiting holy Constitution as weapon to grab power: PM Modi in Haryana’s Hisar
content: PM Modi accuses Congress of playing vote-bank politics; says Congress’s appeasement has resulted in a loss for Muslims

title: India preparing to ship 40,000 tonnes of shrimp to U.S. after tariff pause
content: About 2,000 containers of shrimp that had been delayed are now being readied for export following Trump's April 9 decision to pause the higher tariffs

title: Message on Mumbai police helpline threatens actor Salman Khan; case lodged
content: In the message, received on the traffic police's WhatsApp helpline on Sunday (April 13, 2025), the sender threatened to blow up the actor's car and also  thrash him by entering his residence

title: Murshidabad violence: No major incident in past 36 hours, more than 200 arrested, says West Bengal police
content: The political parties of the Opposition, particularly the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), alleged that about 400 people from Murshidabad had to flee from their homes to escape violence.

title: SC to hear matter related to tree felling in Hyderabad's Kancha Gachibowli forest on April 16
content: The apex court on April 3 directed that until further orders, no activity of any sort, except the protection of the trees already existing there, shall be undertaken by the State or any authority

title: Veteran Kannada comedy actor Bank Janardhan passes away
content: Veteran Kannada comedy actor Bank Janardhan, known for his unique dialogue delivery, passed away at 75 in Bengaluru

title: PM flags off Hisar-Ayodhya flight, lays foundation stone for new terminal building of airport
content: PM Modi also lays the foundation stone of a 800-MW ultra critical modern thermal power unit at the Deenbandhu Chhotu Ram Thermal Power Plant; digitally inaugurates the 14.4-km Rewari Bypass project

title: Coast Guard, ATS seize ₹1,800 crore drugs dumped by smugglers in sea off Gujarat
content: “The seized narcotics have been brought to Porbandar by the ICG ship for further investigations,” the Coast Guard release said

title: President Murmu, Vice-President Dhankhar, PM Modi pay floral tributes to Ambedkar on his 135th birth anniversary
content: Ambedkar’s principles and ideas will strengthen and speed up the building of an ‘aatmanirbhar’ (self-reliant) and developed India, PM Modi said on X

title: Vishu marks auspicious new beginnings, family togetherness and the promise of plentifulness for Keralites
content: A significant section of Keralites considers the first day of the annual Malayalam calendar propitious for new ventures and ideal for setting fresh goals.

title: Congress committed to protection of Constitutional values: Kharge on Ambedkar's birth anniversary
content: Ambedkar described inclusiveness as his ultimate duty for the progress and unity of the country and strongly emphasised protecting the rights of all, the Congress president said

title: As malaria cases fall, a look at Tamil Nadu’s strategies for elimination
content: While cases have been falling in T.N., experts warn that cutting back on healthcare workers could be detrimental to the goal of malaria elimination

title: Mehul Choksi detained in Belgium on India's extradition request
content: Mehul Choksi, his nephew and fugitive diamond trader Nirav Modi and family members and employees, bank officials and others were booked by CBI and ED in 2018 for perpetrating the alleged loan fraud at the Brady House branch of PNB in Mumbai

title: Grand public meeting to follow multiple events to celebrate Basava Jayanti in Kalaburagi on April 29
content: M.Y. Patil said that over 25,000 followers of Basavanna were expected to participate in the event which would begin with a car rally on April 27, followed by a women’s bike rally and the public meeting on April 29

title: Double marginalisation of trans people: Shunned by society, ignored by government
content: There is resentment in the community over being ignored in both State and BBMP Budgets, with little or no allocation being made for their welfare

title: Andhra Pradesh invites proposals for empanelment of drone-as-a-service providers
content: The corporation has extensively studied how drones can be beneficial and in which sectors they can be effectively used

title: Northeast’s first robotic surgery facility unveiled in Assam
content: The Assam government will now offer low-cost, highly precise, and least invasive oncological surgical procedures made in India, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Over 50 posts on ‘fake and misleading’ content on Kancha Gachibowli land row deleted; BRS, Union Minister’s accounts featured
content: The posts, shared primarily between March 31 and April 3, were flagged for spreading misinformation and stirring public sentiment against the government’s proposed plans for the land

title: Devotion, dhols, and delicious delights mark Baisakhi in Hyderabad
content: Day holds dual significance, marking the historic founding of the Khalsa Panth by Guru Gobind Singh in 1699, and celebrating the harvest season for farmers across northern India

title: After Supreme Court verdict, T.N. CM Stalin to chair meeting with Vice-Chancellors, Registrars on April 16
content: Meeting comes in the wake of the Supreme Court’s landmark ruling last week that various Bills pertaining to universities, re-adopted by the Assembly and pending with the President, were deemed to have been granted assent.

title: Thammanam–Pullepady Road project moves at a snail’s pace despite govt. notifications
content: Stakeholders say the proposed 3.70-km four-lane corridor is crucial to revive MG Road’s commercial prospects which was affected during the construction of the Kochi metro viaduct

title: Murshidabad violence: Governor says holding discussions with CM, Centre monitoring situation
content: Bose said a sufficient number of central forces have been deployed and, along with them, the state police are active on the field for timely help and support

title: Mayawati readmits nephew Akash into BSP after he issues public apology
content: Akash said that he apologises for his tweet and added that he would not take any advice from relatives or advisors for political decisions

title: Revival of BJP-AIADMK ties indicates that DMK cannot rest on its laurels
content: The NDA may likely get the PMK and the DMDK onboard even as the latter’s leader, Premallatha Vijayakant, has decided to play a waiting game

title: Early deal with AIADMK is to ensure better coordination among constituents of NDA: BJP leaders
content: BJP’s Central leadership wanted to announce the alliance early to allow sufficient time for cadre of both parties to work in unison to oust the DMK from power, says BJP national co-incharge for T.N.

title: 150 CCTV cameras, 10 days: Bengaluru police nab molestation case accused from Kerala
content: According to the police, the accused was drunk, and the incident was caught by a CCTV camera installed outside a house in the area.

title: TVK chief Vijay moves Supreme Court against Waqf Act
content: Several petitions were filed in the apex court challenging the Act, contending that it was discriminatory towards the Muslim community and violated their fundamental rights

title: FPIs have withdrawn ₹31,575 crore from equities in April over tariff fears
content: According to the data, FPIs pulled out ₹31,575 crore from Indian equities between April 1 and April 11; total withdrawn by FPIs has reached ₹1.48 lakh crore in 2025

title: Police launch probe into strange surge in demand for syringes in Kozhikode
content: Move following alerts from medical shop owners; police suspect that drug pushers are behind the large-scale purchase of syringes

title: Manipur Congress to file petition with Supreme Court against Waqf Act: Ibobi Singh
content: Okram Ibobi Singh challenges Waqf (Amendment) Act, criticises President’s rule in Manipur, urges unity among communities

title: Kozhikode Rural police set to form ward-level vigilance committees to combat drug abuse
content: The police have proposed the formation of ward-level vigilance committees in response to the growing presence of drug pushers in the rural areas of Kozhikode

title: Partial opening of NH 66 at Malapparamba brings relief to commuters
content: Traffic diversions at the junction—first for the construction of the overpass and later to facilitate excavation to a depth of 15 metres—had caused heavy congestion at the busy point

title: No change, clarifies BIAL amid claims of Hindi display board removal at KIA
content: BIAL issued a statement after social media was abuzz with posts along with videos and photos claiming Hindi has been removed from the display boards

title: When 13-year-old Dilshan was shot dead at Army quarters in Chennai
content: Dilshan, 13, of Indira Gandhi Nagar, was brought down by a mysterious bullet in 2011 when he tried to pluck almond from the army quarters. The police established that a retired Army officer had shot him dead. A trial court handed him life imprisonment

title: CAG must audit how policies benefited private firms: Congress on fuel excise duty hike under PM Modi government
content: The Congress leader said along with government companies, the private oil companies are also earning huge profits from refining and marketing, while the common man is burdened with expensive petrol and diesel.

title: Telangana, a pioneer in the implementation of landmark welfare schemes, says Bhatti
content: Fine rice is being distributed to 90 lakh families with ration cards and 2.85 crore beneficiaries across the State, the Deputy Chief Minister said

title: Muslim Personal Law Board protest meeting against waqf legislation at Darussalaam on April 19: Owaisi
content: Owaisi demands answers from PM Modi on whether Sambhal, Mathura and other Muslim would continue to be waqf

title: Karnataka caste census: Amidst tussle over population size, a small percentage desisted from providing caste details
content: A total of 73,399 families, including 53,241 families living in urban areas that accounted for about 2.53 lakh (including 1.12 lakh women), or about 0.425% of the State population refused to identify their caste during the enumeration

title: U.S. NSA Waltz puts off India visit amid ‘Signalgate’ controversy
content: Michael Waltz was due to visit Delhi next week. He is under fire over chats on Messaging platform Signal involving sensitive information such as military operations. He accepted the blame for inadvertently adding a senior journalist to the chat. Vice-President J.D. Vance to continue ‘private’ visit with family.

title: Security incidents in Bengaluru metro raise concern
content: A senior BMRCL official downplayed the concerns, stating incidents of pickpocketing within the Bengaluru metro network remain rare

title: "Why Doesn't Congress Name Muslim Chief": PM Modi's Dare During Waqf Attack
content: the prime minister was speaking at the inauguration ceremony of hisar airport in Haryana . he also questioned why the Congress does not name a Muslim president and reserve 50% of its election tickets for Muslim candidates . the airport will be a significant milestone in the state's development journey .

title: CEO Explains Why Employees In Their 40s Are Losing Jobs Globally
content: the CEO of a grooming and personal care products company has shed light on a concerning pattern of layoffs targeting professionals in their 40s . he explained that employees in the 40s were often the first to be let go when budgets grew tight because they were among the "highest paid" in their organisations .
